reviews.text: Molt bon menjar italiÃ . Racions correctes i vistes magnifiques des de la primera planta.

The food was burnt, but the worst part was that they deceived us by adding a 20% gratuity for six people even though we were only four.
Never told me sorry though, just told me to swipe the credit card because tap is not working.

A must have if youâ€™re in Brooklyn to take the photo of the iconic dumbo bridge! The place has authentic vibes of old Brooklyn

The staff friendly and courteous, the ambience amazing and the food delicious!
Great NY pizza in a historical building!
Delicioso!

Did pick up thru door dash and was lucky to have a few deals to use. Order just the Margherita Pizza and it was exactly what you would expect.  A damn good NY pizza.  It's a shame when you pick up that it's luke warm by the time you walk home (at best). We arrived right at the time they said it would be done and it was already ready to go. Fortunately they had it sitting in their warmer. It would be a nice touch if they notified you if it was done earlier.

Crust was nice and crispy. Pizza sauce was really good. The dough had a really nice flavor.

Would pick up again when craving pizza!

Canâ€™t comment on atmosphere Since we picked up. I know there is always a line when I walk by.

Worth the wait time! Waited around 40 mins for a table for 3 of us but the food made up for it. We had one of the large pizzas between us and did half and half well enough. The servers were wonderful and provided recommendations! The atmosphere is very family friendly but also buzzing

I came in with my family. We were sat on the floor above. Ordered three whole pies, 2 salads, and 8 drinks.
The guys who charged us didnâ€™t mention the tip was included for parties of 8. The card reader was pushed onto my face for extra tipping before even giving me the itemized bill copy that said it was already included. I felt scammed out of tipping twice. For a long while they didnâ€™t even check in on us or refill our water. Very disrespectful.

Lugar muy agradable para comer, las porciones son generosas y tienen muy bien sazÃ³n, pese a no tener reservaciÃ³n y haber algo de gente la espera no fue tan larga, buena variedad de platillos y vinos, de ve que tienen promociones interesantes

Grimaldiâ€™s serves traditional coal-fired brick oven pizza. This is the most famous Grimaldiâ€™s location, right next door to its original location. I tried the Brooklyn Bridge, which comes with roasted red peppers, creamy ricotta, Italian sausage, mozzarella, and a tomato sauce base, and The Don, topped with Italian sausage, meatballs, pepperoni, mozzarella, and tomato sauce. The ricotta on the Brooklyn Bridge wasnâ€™t really my thing, but The Don was delicious. I also had their red sangria, which was very refreshing, and finished off with the Oreo cheesecake for dessert. Highly recommend! They offer three pizza sizes: 12â€, 16â€, and 18â€. We ordered two 18-inch pizzas to share between four people. Even though my friends were pretty hungry, we still ended up with leftovers. In hindsight, two 16-inch pizzas wouldâ€™ve been the perfect amount. We went on a Saturday around 3 p.m. and waited about 30 minutes outside before being seated, so definitely expect a line if you visit on the weekend.

Terrible food !
The pica is burn .

Es un lugar agradable, luminoso y espacioso en la parte de arriba. Venden bÃ¡sicamente pizza en horno de leÃ±a. Probamos la pizza brooklyn bridge y the Don, tenÃ­a mejor sabor la segunda. La salsa de tomate de la pizza estuvo muy rica. Pedimos ensalada para acompaÃ±ar que le queda perfecto. OJO cierran de 4-5 pm para limpiar el horno y cambiar la madera. Intenta llegar a las 3 pm porque hay descuentos en ensaladas y bebidas (nos ahorramos 10 USD.

Best pizza in SWF!
My favorite is the Brooklyn bridge with ricotta cheese, roasted red peppers and sausage ğŸ˜‹

This was our list to revisit due to the history of the pizzeria. Waited about 20 mins were lucky to get sent to front of line since we were only 2 people. The other folks in line had larger parties. Ordered a large cheese and large white Pizza was good not mind blowing a little on the pricey side. There's to many amazing pizzerias in NYC. It's a must visit once at least just for the history of this place it self.

The food was great! The service was terrible. And unfortunately bad service made for a bad experience.

We were sitting for around half an hour before anyone came over to take our order, and only then because we had to find a hostess and ask why no one would come to us. They said they thought we weren't ready, but we had been sitting with our menus closed (or occasionally just perusing) for a WHILE. And they should have at least come by to take our drink orders.

Then, when they did bring our drink orders, they forgot the kids drinks.

We ordered three pizzas, and they only brought one (and it had been sitting for a while. Someone obviously made a mistake somewhere with our order). We had to remind them to bring the other two, and to bring the kids drinks... again.

We had the same experience when we were ready to leave. We told the guy repeatedly we didn't want dessert and were ready to leave, but he put dessert menus down in front of us anyway and walked away. We kept waiting for him to bring the check, or to try to get his attention, until I finally told everyone to just get up and put our coats on. This was maybe another half hour total, and I finally had to find someone and tell them our server wouldn't bring the check.

And they kept trying to take our plates away while we were still eating! They couldn't at least ask if we were ready? We had to literally grab our plates back from people. If they were so eager to get us out of there quickly and flip the table, they shouldn't have made us sit and grumble while hungry for so long.

If they were just busy, that's one thing, but they clearly weren't attentive to our table at all. And we'd have been more understanding if they had said "Sorry we're really behind," but instead they said "Oh we didn't know you wanted to order" and ignored us when we said we didn't want dessert and just wanted the check. That's not being busy, that's bad service.
Great service, better pizza!
My favorite pizza everr! Loved their NY location and now i stop in everytime Iâ€™m in Tampa. Wish they would open a location in Orlando area

After living 2 years in the US, I finally got some pizza with proper flavors! Even the most snobbish napoletana enjoyers will melt when tasting it! There is usually a line for the place, keep that in mind.

I love this pizzeria to the moon and back, and I will glaze it to the day I die. Best pizza I've ever had, came crispy and fresh. The restaurant looked amazing and the whole place smelled delicious. Even the bathrooms were nice. Only complaint is that the service took some time, but there were probably 200 people inside, so it's not a problem. It was top-notch stuff. Absolute cuisine. â­â­â­â­â­

Pizza isnâ€™t that great and they have rich people prices. Two pizzaâ€™s and 7 drinks for $150. Server treated us horrible knowing heâ€™s going to get an outrageous automatic gratuity . Will not go here again. Server came and refilled our drinks, even though we didnâ€™t ask him to and we were charged double for them. Disgusted with this place taking advantage of people, if you have more than 2 people you get charged the $21 in gratuity, if you have 4 itâ€™s $40 automatic gratuity. If you have 6 itâ€™s $60. Negative 10 .
Amazing service fabulous food and really welcoming definitely would recommend if in brooklyn â¤ï¸
We absolutely loved this place! We took our high school aged grandkids to visit on a recent New York trip and they were so glad that we planned to do this!

Best pizza I've ever had hands down

Absolutely worth the hype! The pizza at Grimaldiâ€™s is just on another level â€” the crust is perfectly crisp, the sauce has that real fresh tomato flavor, and the cheese melts beautifully. You can really taste the wood-fired quality in every bite. The staff was friendly and fast even though it was busy, and the old-school Brooklyn atmosphere just adds to the charm. Great place to bring friends or visitors for a real NYC pizza experience!

In Brooklyn from out of town and havenâ€™t had Grimaldiâ€˜s pizza in forever and a day. Our server, whose name is Ralph was completely accommodating, welcomed us and took such great care of us during our visit. The food was absolutely amazing and I completely loved how the entire staff worked as a team to take care of the guests
Best Pizza in Brooklyn!
Really lovely pizza. The sauce is so good! Visiting from the U.K. and weâ€™ve been here before impressived!

This is how my pizza was delivered. It was cold, stale, and the pizza was cut improperly.

I'm not sure how this place is as rated as it is. You can find $1 slices literally anywhere that are better than this garbage.

Take that and the fact that I paid $45 for this order... I want my money back.
Still one of the best pizza places in the city

We were 2 and almost finished 2 large pizzaâ€™s.
Great taste and customer service

Pizza was great but definitely donâ€™t go here if youâ€™re in any kind of time crunch. Took 45 minutes to get our one pizza from the time we ordered. Got seated right away though and the waiter was nice too but very slow

Segunda vez que estoy en nueva york y vuelvo a comer una buena pizza, lo malo el servicio recibido, pedimos la pizza a las 13:49 y despuÃ©s de mas de una hora tenemos que reclamar nuestra pizza. Otras mesas llegando, comiendo y marchando, nosotros seguimos esperando, a las 15:30 llego la pizza que se olvidaron servirnos y encima al cobrarnos preguntan si dejamos propina,no os la merecÃ©is....por lo menos hoy.
Resting on their laurels. Awful app experience, canâ€™t even complete an order. Embarrassing!

This place uses Coal brick oven which makes a huge difference. Ended up getting the Margherita Pizza. The dough and crisp was something else. Awesome location too. Canâ€™t go wrong with pizza and the amazing views at Pier 1. Definitely come give this place a try.
Mediocre pizza at best, exceptionally high prices.
Really good pizza and great views nearby
Best pizza in New York. Period

Went here for the first time and was genuinely surprised at how delicious the pizza was. We just went back from a trip to Italy, and dare we say that this NY Pizza is better than those in Naples ğŸ™Š.

Also, staff were super nice! It was my birthday just a few days back and they gave me a cheesecake on the house even though it was only the first time us going there. 10/10 would definitely come back.
Waiting for 1 hour

What disappointing experience. This NYC pizza icon has really gone on the decline. To sum it up the place was dingy and dirty, the pizza was well done on top and doughy and under cooked on the bottom, the sauce had very little flavor. They used to drizzle a little olive oil on the pie before bringing it out, I guess they don't do that any more and the soda was flat. The only bright spot was the service, the waitress was very nice and attentive but even the good service is not enough to go back to this place. Double thumbs down for this place ğŸ‘ğŸ‘ğŸ•ğŸ•
Order my pie and it was thin cardboard with no sauce or cheese . With 9k reviews I was expecting much better.
Their "Brooklyn Bridge" special with the creamy ricotta cheese is amazing!

I wish I could give 5 stars. I had looked forward to eating here after hearing such good things about it. But in all honesty, I thought it was very much like many other pizza places in New York. It was good, but not spectacular and it had been hyped beyond its worth. Donâ€™t get me wrong, itâ€™s not bad. Itâ€™s just not better than other places.
